page.title: 07FARMING, DEEPCAR/WORTLEY
page.content: Farming in the area is generally mixed, with{sheep}on the poorly soiled upland slopes(Hunshelf Bank){beef {cattle}on the gentler slopes(Bank End, Moorside Farms) and{grains}(mainly wheat and barley) on the flatter ground below Wharncliffe Chase. {Grass}is grown for both pasture, hay and silage. There are some{dairy herds(Smithy Fields, Townend Farms). {Horses, poultry and pigs}are also kept, especially on the smallholdings. A typical hill farm might be Bitholmes Farm (Mr. Conroy): 44 acres: 20ac. hay, 5ac. woodland, 18ac. pasture. Suckler herd(beef), 6 Welsh ponies, 3 chickens,2 dogs and 3 cats. There is an old, disused sty. {FORESTRY. The Forestry Comission own large areas of Wharncliffe Wood with both coniferous and deciduous trees.
